faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about Gulf Rate and foreign exchange in Saudi Arabia

items.question: How often are exchange rates updated?
items.answer: Gulf Rate updates exchange rates from all providers several times per day. Most rates are refreshed every 1-3 hours during business hours. The exact time of the last update is displayed alongside each rate in the comparison table.

items.question: Is Gulf Rate a money transfer service?
items.answer: No, Gulf Rate is a comparison platform. We help you find the best exchange rates and transfer services, but we don't process transfers ourselves. Once you find a provider with favorable rates, you'll be directed to their official website to complete your transaction.

items.question: How do rate alerts work?
items.answer: When you sign up for rate alerts, you can specify your target exchange rate. Once any of our providers offers a rate that meets or exceeds your target, we'll send you an immediate notification via email or SMS so you can take advantage of the favorable rate.

items.question: Which currencies does Gulf Rate support?
items.answer: We currently focus on the most popular corridors for expatriates in Saudi Arabia, including Saudi Riyal (SAR) to Indian Rupee (INR), Pakistani Rupee (PKR), Philippine Peso (PHP), Bangladeshi Taka (BDT), Nepalese Rupee (NPR), Egyptian Pound (EGP), and major global currencies like USD, EUR, and GBP.

items.question: Is Gulf Rate available in other Gulf countries?
items.answer: We're currently fully operational in Saudi Arabia and are in the process of expanding to other Gulf countries including UAE, Qatar, Kuwait, Bahrain, and Oman. You can sign up for notifications to be alerted when we launch in your country.
